name: NATO
description: This alphabet dates from about 1955 and is approved by the International Civil Aviation OrganizationCOMMA the FAA and the International Telecommunication Union. note that different bodies prefer different spellingsCOMMA so one also sees: Alfa Juliett Juliette Oskar Viktor

name: Telecom B
description: Found also in SwedishCOMMA DutchCOMMA Hungarian telephone directories. An 'analogy alphabet' in a Kenyan directory has Charlie and no Y. A Swiss directory: Andrew Charlie Lussy Queenie Sugar. French/German vocabulary books: Andrew Charlie Lucy Mike Nelly Sugar Xmas. English phrase books for Spanish/Italian speakers: Charlie. A 'British English' alphabet in a Langenscheidt dictionary: Andrew Charlie Lucy Queenie Sugar Xmas. Norwegian dictionary: Andrew Charlie Lucy Sugar Victory Xerxes. Collins Polish dictionary: Andrew Charlie Lucy Sugar Xmas..Used as an English alphabet by telephone operators in Israel

name: British A
description: An 'international' alphabet in a Dutch telephone directory has: Danemark. A 'French' alphabet in a Hungarian directory has: Cassablanka Danemark Que'bec Upsala Zu"rich. An 'international' alphabet in a business book for French has: Italy Kilogram Zu"rich. the corresponding book for German has: Italy Kilogram Xanthippe Zu"rich. An 'international' alphabet in a Langenscheidt dictionary: Danemark Madagaskar Que'bec Upsala Xanthippe Zu"rich. An 'international' alphabet in a Larousse business book: Danemark Je'rusalem Que'bec Xanthippe..West Berlin telephone directory 1965: Danemark Je'rusalem Madagaskar Que'bec Upsala Xanthippe Zu"rich. Santa Fe (Argentina) 1955: Dinamarca Habana Jerusale'n Kilogramo Nueva_York N~andubay Upsala Wa'shington Xantipo Yokoama. Azores 1966: Danemark Ita'lia Jerusale'm New-York Que'bec Upsala Yokoham..Used as a French alphabet by telephone operators in Israel

name: Johannesburg Telephone Directory
description: Note similarity to Alfred Benjamin

name: New York City Police
description: Note similarity to ARRL and Western Union..Variants: Eddie Larry Nancy Thomas Yankee Yellow

name: Nassau County PoliceCOMMA Long IslandCOMMA New York
Amateur Radio
description: Alternative phonetics sometimes used unofficially in amateur radio..Also: AmsterdamCOMMA BaltimoreCOMMA BrazilCOMMA ChileCOMMA EgyptCOMMA FinlandCOMMA GenevaCOMMA GreeceCOMMA GuatemalaCOMMA HawaiiCOMMA ItalyCOMMA KentuckyCOMMA KingCOMMA LuxembourgCOMMA MontrealCOMMA NicaraguaCOMMA PortugalCOMMA RomaniaCOMMA RussiaCOMMA SwedenCOMMA TexasCOMMA UruguayCOMMA Venezuela

name: ARRL (American Radio Relay League)
description: Note similarity to Western Union and Able Baker..Nowadays the ARRL endorses the NATO/ICAO/ITU alphabet

name: Pre-1954 U.S. Navy Radio
description: (Communications HandbookCOMMA 1945)..Note similarity to Able Buy Cast..Formerly used by IBM engineers for hex digits and pin positions. still used at at least one site.

name: Royal Navy
description: Wrens at Bletchley Park: Apple James Kenneth(?) Oliver Peter Quagga Unicorn William Xray

name: British Forces
description: The OED has a reference for Beer and Emma dated 1891

name: A comme Anatole
description: Contributor: Erik Tjong Kim Sang <erikt@let.rug.nl>

name: Larousse Business Book
description: Belgian versions: Caesar Fre'de'rique kilogram Sophie Ce'sar Emile Simon Xanthippe..Note: there are some parallel French/Dutch alphabets for use in Belgium

name: Berlitz and AA phrase books
description: with the addition of E'mile for e-acute this is the official Post Office alphabet

description: Contributor: Hermann Schumacher <hschu@ebs.e-technik.uni-ulm.de> (official alphabet for emergency servicesCOMMA from "KatS-Dv 810 - Sprechfunkdienst"COMMA 1977)
